text: are you looking for something just a
little bit different to do with your
steak tonight why not try marinating it
in a combination of pineapple juice and
soy sauce it's really good and then you
can char up some poblanos and white
onions and make a delicious relish to
serve on the side I am using a skirt
steak and I'm just removing a little bit
of the fat the marinade is super simple
quarter cup of pineapple juice and two
tablespoons of soy sauce it's gonna add
a lot of flavor put your steak in their
turn to coat it and then let it sit for
at least 20 minutes while the steak is
marinating get your relish ready I have
three poblanos on a rimmed baking sheet
and to that I'm gonna add some sliced
white onion and have your broiler
preheating these are going to be broiled
until they're slightly charred and
softened that'll take between seven and
ten minutes you're gonna want to turn
them once while you're doing it when the
poblanos are nice and soft and slightly
charred you should easily be able to
remove the skin open them up and then I
just sort of brushed the seeds out with
my paper towel then the onions get
chopped actually everything just gets
chopped together it's a rustic moment I
just mean not necessarily completely
perfect same thing for the peppers just
a coarse chop combine your onions and
your peppers in a bowl and then add a
quarter cup of lime juice a tablespoon
of neutral vegetable oil like a
safflower oil or something like that and
then a little bit of cilantro this is a
couple tablespoons give it a coarse chop
a little bit of salt pepper and that's
it give it a little stir now all we have
to do is cook our steak and that I'm
gonna do on the grill have your grill
preheating to like a medium-high or even
a high brush it lightly with any neutral
flavored oil then just take your steak
lift it out of the marinade and let it
drip off and then just right on to your
hot grill don't be surprised if you get
pretty strong grill marks on this
because the pineapple juice is going to
cause it caramelize even faster than
regular steak using your steak on the
grill like I do and then when you turn
the other side confusing that side - did
you take about three to five minutes per
side from medium-rare
once the sear has formed they shouldn't
stick to you to be able to remove them
easily and turn them over when they're
done take the steaks off the grill and
let them rest for about five minutes to
allow the juices to redistribute that
way it'll be nice and sort of rosy pink
throughout skirt steak is great sliced
across the grain so it makes it easier
to eat a little less chewy I'm just
using my fingers forgive me but some of
that relish on top
now it's time to enjoy the fruits of
your labor
it's really good deep flavored skirt
steak marinated in pineapple juice and
soy couldn't be better
I highly recommend it
